name: Ann-Kristin Kölln
body:
I am a Research Fellow at the [Centre for Political Research] (https://soc.kuleuven.be/centre-for-political-research) at [KU Leuven] (http://www.kuleuven.be/english/). Previously, I held positions as [COFAS Marie Curie Fellow] (http://forte.se/om-forte/internationella-samarbeten/europa/cofas/) at the [University of Gothenburg] (http://pol.gu.se/english/?languageId=100001&disableRedirect=true&returnUrl=http%3A%2F%2Fpol.gu.se%2F) and as Junior Researcher at the [University of Twente] (https://www.utwente.nl/bms/pa/), where I also obtained by Ph.D. in 2014. 

My teaching and research interest include European political parties, public opinion of political processes, and theories of representative democracy.

At the University of Twente I was part of the Dutch [European Social Survey] (http://www.europeansocialsurvey.org) and involved in the design and analyses of several population-based survey experiments that answer methodological and substantive research questions. I am also the co-principal investigator of the [2015 Swedish Party Membership survey] (http://partiforskning.gu.se/Forskning+om+partier/partimedlemsundersokning/party-membership-survey-2015). It contains information on political attitudes and behaviour of more than 10,000 members of seven political parties.  



###Publications  



**Peer-reviewed journal articles**

“[Emancipated Party Members: Examining Ideological Incongruence within Political Parties](http://ppq.sagepub.com/content/early/2016/06/22/1354068816655566.full.pdf+html)” *Party Politics*, forthcoming. (with Jonathan Polk)
-- featured in [LSE EUROPP blog](http://blogs.lse.ac.uk/europpblog/2016/09/12/evidence-from-sweden-how-internal-disagreements-affect-the-success-of-political-parties/), 11 September 2016.

2016    “[The Virtuous Circle of Representation](http://www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0261379416000305)” *Electoral Studies*, 42, pp. 126-134.

2016	“[Party Membership in Europe: Testing Party-Level Explanations of Decline](http://ppq.sagepub.com/content/22/4/465.full.pdf+html)” *Party Politics*, 22(4), pp. 465-477.
        -- featured in [Democratic Audit UK (LSE)](http://www.democraticaudit.com/2015/07/27/not-all-parties-lose-members-but-those-that-do-are-older-and-more-institutionalised/), 27 July 2015.

2015	“[Does Party Finance Regulation Create a Level Playing Field?](http://online.liebertpub.com/doi/pdf/10.1089/elj.2015.0335)” *Election Law Journal: Rules, Politics, and Policy*, 15(1), pp. 71-82.

2015	“[The Effects of Membership Decline on Party Organisations in Europe] (http://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/1475-6765.12110/full)” *European Journal of Political Research*, 54(4), pp. 707-725.
        -- featured in “[Wie reagieren Parteien auf den Mitgliederschwund?](http://www.kas.de/wf/de/33.39868/)“ Konrad Adenauer-Stiftung e.V., 2014/2015.

2015	“[External Efficacy and Perceived Responsiveness – Similar but Distinct Concepts](http://ijpor.oxfordjournals.org/content/27/3/432)” *International Journal of Public Opinion Research*, 27(3), pp.423-455. (with Peter Esaiasson and Sedef Turper)

2015	“[The Value of Political Parties to Representative Democracy](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/european-political-science-review/article/the-value-of-political-parties-to-representative-democracy/F019B8C30DC43868D8FB4E81FFC267F7)” *European Political Science Review*, 7(4), pp. 593-613.
        -- featured in [Democratic Audit UK (LSE)](http://www.democraticaudit.com/2015/01/06/despite-their-manifest-flaws-political-parties-improve-democracy-it-is-implausible-that-it-could-be-successful-without-them/), 6 January 2015.



**Book**

2014	*Party decline and response. The effects of membership decline on party organisations in Western Europe, 1960-2010*. Enschede: University of Twente.
        -- Winner of the [2015 Jaarprijs Politicologie for the best Ph.D. dissertation](http://politicologie.nl/?page_id=15), Dutch and Belgian Political Science Association.



**Edited volume**

“[The Lives of the Party: Contemporary Approaches to the Study of Intraparty Politics in Europe] (http://ppq.sagepub.com/content/early/2016/06/27/1354068816655572.full.pdf+html)” Special Issue for *Party Politics*, forthcoming. (with Jonathan Polk)



**Contributions in edited volumes**

2015	“The Party Organizations.” in *The Oxford Handbook of Swedish Politics*, Jon Pierre, ed., Oxford: Oxford University Press. (with Gissur Erlingsson and Patrik Öhberg)

2013	“Signalling Through Voting Intention Polls Between Elections.” in *Between-Election Democracy: The Representative Relationship After Election Day*, Peter Esaiasson and Hanne Marthe Narud, eds., Colchester: ECPR. (with Kees Aarts)



**Governmental report**

2015	“Det sjunkande antalet partimedlemskap och demokratin.” in *Låt fler forma framtiden! Forskarantologi*. Statens Offentliga Utredningar, ed., Stockholm: Wolters Kluwer Sverige. SOU: 2015:96



**Book review**

2016	[“Beyond party members: Changing approaches to partisan mobilization” by Susan E. Scarrow (2015, Oxford University Press)](https://www.cambridge.org/core/journals/perspectives-on-politics/article/beyond-party-members-changing-approaches-to-partisan-mobilization-by-scarrow-susan-e-new-york-oxford-university-press-2015-256p-9000/3BB4A64805061EB177BE77EE77740A6A/core-reader) *Perspectives on Politics*, 14(3), pp 914-915.
